page.title: 19CHRISTCHURCH QUAY (POEM)
page.content: {Time}is pleasant where two rivers meet {With}the sun beating down its heavenly rays, {The}spreading ripples sparkling brightly,{Like}a forgotten treasure of an unknown land;{The}reeds dancing in the playful breeze,{A hypnotic}motion to send us dreaming.{Elderly}people sleeping on the sun-scorched grass,{In a land far beyond nod.{Distant}chatter breaking the silence{ But}not disturbing the peace and tranquility. {The}gentle throb of motor boat engines {And}the lapping of water against their bows.{A}place to rest and think and ponder-{Time}is pleasant where two rivers meet.
